intro: Ottonia martiana var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf ottonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red and orange. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
